title: Update nix to 0.26.2, bump up fclones to 0.32.1
body:
Vulnerabilities found in an old version of nix.
Fixes dependabot alerts.

title: Disable "Find duplicates" button when input paths list is empty
body: Fixes #210

title: Fix max size slider not sticking to Unlimited setting
body:
When the max size slider was set manually to Unlimited position, it did not update the model properly. So instead of unlimited, the real limit was about 850 GB.

Fixes #209

title: GUI in GTK+ and Relm4
rlimit.rs: fix return type of rlimit_nofile on 32-bit systems
body: fixes build error for 32-bit targets.

title: If a file vanished do not print an access performance warning
body:
File extents are used to speed up reading -- but if a file no
longer exists then any warning about retrieving this information
can be ignored.

title: Remove fallback to symbolic links
body:
Falling back to softlinks between different devices is dangerous and can lead to data loss. It is better to just fail and let the user specify if they want symbolic links manually.

Now fclones will attempt to create hard links only within the same filesystem.

Fixes #196

title: Feat: --skip-content-hash, --max-prefix-size, --max-suffix-size options
body:
Partially fixes: https://github.com/pkolaczk/fclones/issues/201

(Completely open to changes in the naming/wording/api/etc.)

### Changes

- Upgrade deps
- Add `--max-prefix-size` and `--max-suffix-size` options
  - These options will set the max prefix and suffix size for the prescan, reducing the chance of duplicates before the full hash scan.
- Add `--skip-content-hash` option
  - Skips the final stage content hash, and just returns the result after the suffix stage (didn't implement for `--transform`)

### Potential Follow-up

Random chunk checks:

`--random-chunk-checks=5`
`--random-chunk-size=16MiB`

Though prefix and suffix size checks are a great pre-filtering step, they are of course the parts of the file that would seem the most likely to be the same among different files. However, there are still cases where fully-hashing the file would take a prohibitively long time or be too expensive.

Instead of a full hash, we could use the file's byte-size as a seed to randomly select `n` chunks to read from and group in the same fashion as the prefix and suffix checks. Doing this should make it very unlikely for duplication while still being orders of magnitude faster than full content hashing. It also has the nice side effect of being a great continuous tuning-lever to find a balance between safety and speed.

title: Obey the open file descriptor limit when grouping files
body:
Given enough CPU cores and the multiplication factor fclones uses, the number of threads and therefore approximately the maximum number of open files can exceed the usual limit of 1024 on Linux. On macOS this tends to be even lower.

Then some of the "fetch file extents mapping" and "compute hash of file" steps fail with "Too many open files (os error 24)".

To fix this, retrieve the current limit, increase it if possible and stay below it.

Only used on Unix systems.

title: Restore timestamp (and only timestamp) after reflinking on linux
body:
Now `linux_reflink()` has no visible user space effects except for the updated ctime, just as `safe_reflink()` does since v0.27.2.

Also, only restore the timestamp and not all other unchanged metadata of the parent directory of a deduped file.

title: Fix panic caused by path prefix on Windows
body:
Paths on Windows can have a multi-component root.
E.g. C:\ is encoded as two components
'C:' and '\'. Unfortunately Path::root() and
Path::strip_root() didn't account for that properly and stripped only the first component instead of stripping the whole root. That led to incorrect path processing in `fclones move` command and panic.

Fixes #185

title: Upgrade dependencies
Fix compilation on windows
body:
Add missing type cast.
Windows file identifiers are 128-bit.

title: Bump up bumpalo to 3.12 to fix use-after-free vulnerability
Fix quoting and splitting command args containing single quotes
Fix race condition in test_file_hash causing spurious test failures
body:
Use `NamedTempFile` to avoid using the same, clashing filenames when several hash tests are run concurrently.

This fixes #179.

<hr>

I ran `while true; do nice /run/current-system/sw/bin/cargo test test_file_hash || break; done` on NixOS 22.11 to confirm that this actually fixed the problem.

title: Fix compilation on non 64-bit targets
body:
Should this be usize instead of u64? It has the same size as u64 on 64-bit platforms and size of 4 bytes on 32-bit platforms. 

'Cause of this fixed usage project doesn't compile for mips platform for example.


https://github.com/pkolaczk/fclones/blob/0fcad39914323bddc5268f8532f1e21cfb32b3ca/src/group.rs#L618

title: Enable LTO again
Reword and reformat help and usage information, readd --version
Upgrade clap from 2.x to 4.0
Pluggable logging and progress reporting
Refactor test module so intellij IDEA is happy
body: See: https://github.com/intellij-rust/intellij-rust/issues/9366

title: Check Rust version in cargo

   --> src/hasher.rs:264:42

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gelmini <andrea.gelmini@gelma.net>

title: Allow to select hash function; support xxhash3, blake3, sha256, sha512, sha3
macOS - '/System/Volumes/Data' DiskDevice path remapping
body:
Fixes https://github.com/pkolaczk/fclones/issues/158

On macOS APFS disk all users' data is mounted in '/System/Volumes/Data' but fused transparently using firmlinks and presented as part of the root filesystem. It requires remapping Data volume path for this DiskDevice to '/' in order for fclones correctly recognise device deduplicated files are on.

Ref: 

https://www.swiftforensics.com/2019/10/macos-1015-volumes-firmlink-magic.html

https://eclecticlight.co/2020/01/23/catalina-boot-volumes/

title: Restore extended file attributes after dedupe
body: Fixes #152

title: Display path in the warning msg when file metadata can't be accessed
body:
Before:
    warn: Permission denied (os error 13)

After:
    warn: Failed to read metadata of /.../file.txt: Permission
    denied (os error 13)

Fixes #147

title: Apply post_group_filter in rehash on all groups
body:
The filter was not applied on items matched by pre-filter
which in some cases led to incorrect reporting of unique files.

Fixes #148

title: Rollup of bug fixes for Windows
Don't hash files with same inode identifiers more than once
body:
This optimization speeds up processing if the file tree contains
symbolic or hard links. Symbolic and hard links to the same data
will be hashed at most once. The algorithm is also smart enough
to not hash the data at all, if it determines that no other (unlinked)
matches are possible.

Fixes #139.

title: Fix typos
body:
Thanks a lot for your work.

Just a stupid/little patch about typos.

title: Make generating dedupe script parallel again
body:
Dedupe script generation was changed to single-threaded
in one of an earlier commits in order to fix the ordering
of the commands printed in --dry-run.

Unfortunately this caused a performance degradation
because the script generation involves a significant amount of I/O.
The script generation could not keep up with the pace at which
multiple threads can process the commands, and those threads
were heavily spinning waiting for work.

This commit reverts that change and implements the ordering of items
in a different way. Now all FsCommands are sent to
a PriorityQueue which puts them back in the correct order.

Fixes #138

title: Show the current phase number next to the progress bar. Fix --transform for files differing in length.
Allow --cache and --transform
body:
The cache is now split into multiple keyspaces.
Each keyspace is responsible for caching file hashes
for one hash algorithm and one transform.

Fixes #131

title: Updated '--caseless' to '-i' in exiv2 example
body: I assume that --caseless was renamed to -i at some point.

title: Fix order of dedupe --dry-run
body: Fixes #96

title: Redesign link handling
Don't allow to use --cache with --transform
body:
Currently --cache doesn't have any effect if --transform is given.
This limitation will be removed in the future, but it requires
more work on caching.

title: Skip checking of file sizes if --transform was applied
Treat libc::ENOTSUP as ErrorKind::Unsupported
Add an option to skip locking files
body:
Use --no-lock to disable locking.
Useful on filesystems that don't support locking at all.

Fixes #121.

title: Add option to output symbolic links to files
body:
A new flag is added: -S | --symbolic-links.
When set, fclones treats symbolic links to files as regular files
and reports links instead of link targets.

Fixes #100

title: Respect .gitignore and .fdignore. Skip hidden files by default.
body:
Additionally, the options for controlling hidden files selection
have been changed. `--skip-hidden` has been removed, and replaced
with `--hidden` which has the opposite meaning. The short option
for including hidden files is `-.` as in ripgrep.
`-A` has been repurposed to mean `--no-ignore`
(A stands for "All files").

Fixes #101

title: Update sysinfo crate
Fix windows build issues
Use fclones::path::Path for GroupConfig::base_dir
Refactoring: move grouping related stuff to group.rs.
Persistent caching of file hashes
body:
This commit implements a new feature, enabled by --cache flag.

Caching can dramatically improve grouping speed on subsequent runs of
`fclones` at the expense of some additional
storage space needed for the cache. Caching also allows for resuming
work quickly after interruption, so it is
recommended if you plan to run `fclones` on huge data sets.

The cache works as follows:
- Each newly computed file hash is persisted in the cache together with
  some metadata of the file such as its modification timestamp and
  length.
- Whenever a file hash needs to be computed, it is first looked up in
  the cache. The cached hash is used if the current metadata of the
  file strictly matches the metadata stored in the cache.

title: Only use the reflink crate on Linux for tests
body:
Version 0.1.3 of the reflink crate does not compile with the musl libc.
However this lib is only used for "crosstesting" on Linux, the tool
itself already calls the ioctl for file cloning directly.

---

Fixes #95

title: Fix handling of non-unicode and control chars in paths
body:
Paths stored in reports are now in STFU-8 format,
which escapes non-UTF8, special and control characters,
so that text files produced by fclones are always valid UTF-8.
Additionally, newlines won't mess up the report file format.

A side effect of this change is that on Windows, the backslash
character ('\') used as a directory delimiter is
encoded as a double backslash '\\'.

Fixes #102

title: Restore parent dir metadata on reflink
body:
Deduplicating a file should not affect the mtime of its parent
directory.

Fixes #93

title: Don't use ctime in isolated_roots test
body:
On some systems, ctime is not available.
Actually the test does not need ctime at all
to test grouping by root.

Fixes #104

title: Fix incorrect number of duplicate files reported with --isolate
body: Fixes #99

title: Dedupe isolated roots
body: Respect isolated path roots in link/remove/move/dedupe commands

title: Always restore metadata after reflink
body: Fixes #86

title: Improve warning message when FIEMAP not supported
body:
Now if the file systtem does not support ioctl FIEMAP,
the following warning is displayed once:

[2021-10-31 19:54:13.102] fclones:  warn: File system fuseblk on
device /dev/sda doesn't support FIEMAP ioctl API. This is generally
harmless, but random access performance might be decreased because
fclones can't determine physical on-disk location of file data needed
for reading files in the optimal order.

Fixes #83

title: Make initializing libc::flock more portable
body:
Different Unixes seem to have flock differing by
the set of fields. We don't need those fields in this case,
so we just initialize them to zero.

Fixes #85

title: Documentation improvements
Reflink bugfix, examples in --help
Implement `fclones dedupe` command
body:
Deduplicate the underlying storage of files without
making visible changes to the files themselves.

If a deduplicated file is later written, the affected
blocks will first be copied (copy on write, or COW).

Currently only supported by the filesystems btrfs and
XFS on Linux, and APFS on macOS.

Will not fall back to another method on failure.

title: Implement `fclones dedupe` command
body:
Deduplicate the underlying storage of files without
making visible changes to the files themselves.

If a deduplicated file is later written, the affected
blocks will first be copied (copy on write, or COW).

Currently only supported by the filesystems btrfs and
XFS on Linux, and APFS on macOS.

Will not fall back to another method on failure.

title: Extract linting and formatting to separate CircleCI jobs
Add snap support
